men for support. They often face stigma or rejection from family or community.
• Adolescents often feel very alone and scared – and may not have disclosed their pregnancy to anyone. They
need gentle and welcoming help. If not treated respectfully, they are less likely to attend regular antenatal care
which increases poor birth outcomes.
